programme.title: World Cinema
programme.desc: Shorts full of suspense include ``Delay`` from Iran, in which a father and his children experience drama at the airport; South African film ``Gallo Rojo``; ``Vlado`` is inspired by the life of a Brazilian journalist who disappeared.

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: Stories about young girls include ``Rumspringa Prelude,`` where an Amish family's daughter gets a surprise; ``Woo Woo``; ``The Keyhole``; a girl tries to save her family in ``The Extraordinary World of Cecily Blinkstop.``.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: In ``Time Out,`` a long-distance relationship is put to the test as a couple pretend to meet as their younger selves; a woman goes on a mysterious journey in ``Lacrimosa.``.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: Romantic comedy shorts about married couples with children include ``The Birth,`` where a husband and wife's plans for a birth differ; a couple get some us-time without their kids in ``A Day Without``; ``The Frame.``.

programme.title: Crime
programme.desc: Welcome to Crime, the show that bands together a group of misfit movies and presents them to you like a line up at a police station. Tonight people will try to bury the hatchet with their enemies. But can they forgive and forget?

programme.title: Editor's Pick
programme.desc: Shorts where people get mixed up in crime; in ``Eagle Rock,`` a woman jailed for murder recalls how she joined a cult, and in ``Traveling Man,`` a Tinder fan and his Uber driver rolls into trouble.

programme.title: Editor's Pick
programme.desc: Shorts about invasive artificial intelligence assistants include ``Iris,`` in which a woman's decision to change her in-home AI system has severe consequences; in ``G.I.A.,`` a man goes out and lets an AI app call the shots.

programme.title: Temptation: Confessions of a Marriage Counselor
programme.desc: An ambitious intern (Jurnee Smollett-Bell) at matchmaking firm for millionaires has an extramarital affair with a charismatic client whose boldness and charm mask a dark side.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: He Got Game
programme.desc: A convict's (Denzel Washington) freedom depends upon convincing his estranged son (Ray Allen), a basketball star, to attend the governor's alma mater.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: In the wake of another death, Boyd questions his decision to leave; Kenny steps up and embraces his new role; Jim rallies the town around his idea to build a radio tower; Fatima urges Ellis to make amends with his father before it is too late.

programme.title: Across the Universe
programme.desc: Songs by the Beatles illustrate a tale of two star-crossed lovers (Evan Rachel Wood, Jim Sturgess) swept up by the 1960s counterculture and the anti-war movement.

programme.title: The Thin Red Line
programme.desc: The men (Sean Penn, Adrien Brody, Jim Caviezel) of Charlie Company try to take Guadalcanal Island from the Japanese in World War II.

programme.title: Mighty Oak
programme.desc: Gina's life is given new purpose when she meets a young guitar prodigy. Convinced the boy is her reincarnated brother, frontman for Army of Love, she sets out to get the band back together.

programme.title: Hope Gap
programme.desc: A housewife's life begins to unravel when her husband of 29 years decides to leave her for another woman. With support from her son, she tries to regain her footing while learning it's never too late to be happy.

programme.title: Elvis Goes There
programme.desc: Elvis Mitchell meets filmmaker Paul Feig in London for a firsthand look at the evolution of his career in film, with the city's elegant style and traditions as a backdrop.

programme.title: Forever My Girl
programme.desc: Liam Page is a country music superstar who left his bride Josie at the altar to pursue fame and fortune. Now, he must face the consequences of his actions when he returns to his hometown for the funeral of his best friend from high school.

programme.title: Trauma Center
programme.desc: Alone and trapped in a locked-down hospital isolation ward overnight, an injured young woman must escape a pair of vicious killers who are after the only piece of evidence that can implicate them in a grisly murder: the bullet in her leg.

programme.title: He Got Game
programme.desc: A convict's (Denzel Washington) freedom depends upon convincing his estranged son (Ray Allen), a basketball star, to attend the governor's alma mater.

programme.title: Across the Universe
programme.desc: Songs by the Beatles illustrate a tale of two star-crossed lovers (Evan Rachel Wood, Jim Sturgess) swept up by the 1960s counterculture and the anti-war movement.

programme.title: Regarding Henry
programme.desc: Two bullets force a career-driven Manhattan lawyer (Harrison Ford) to start life over with his loving wife (Annette Bening) and daughter.

programme.title: Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: An Arizona lumberjack (D.B. Sweeney) turns up five days later after being hit by a light from the sky.

programme.title: Arrival
programme.desc: A linguistics professor (Amy Adams) leads an elite team of investigators in a race against time to communicate with extraterrestrial visitors.

programme.title: The Doors
programme.desc: UCLA film student Jim Morrison (Val Kilmer) finds a girlfriend (Meg Ryan), forms a band and turns tragic 1960s rock star.

programme.title: The Accused
programme.desc: Raped in a bar, a woman (Jodie Foster) hires a prosecutor (Kelly McGillis) who goes after the patrons who encouraged her attackers.

programme.title: Dead Man Walking
programme.desc: A nun (Susan Sarandon) helps a double murderer (Sean Penn) deal with his actions and prepare for his execution in a New Orleans prison.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: In the wake of another death, Boyd questions his decision to leave; Kenny steps up and embraces his new role; Jim rallies the town around his idea to build a radio tower; Fatima urges Ellis to make amends with his father before it is too late.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: Named Atlanta's best comedian in 2017, Mia Jackson is the country girl next door people want to be best friends with as she delivers hilariously snarky jokes about relatable subjects.

programme.title: Silence
programme.desc: Two 17th-century Portuguese missionaries (Andrew Garfield, Adam Driver) face the ultimate test of faith when they travel to Japan to find their missing mentor.

programme.title: Priceless
programme.desc: A troubled widower (Joel Smallbone) tries to save two young Mexican sisters after he discovers them in the back of the truck that he's driving cross-country for a one-time payment.

programme.title: Words and Pictures
programme.desc: An art teacher and English teacher have a competition and allow students to vote on the importance of words and pictures.

programme.title: The Doors
programme.desc: UCLA film student Jim Morrison (Val Kilmer) finds a girlfriend (Meg Ryan), forms a band and turns tragic 1960s rock star.

programme.title: The Accused
programme.desc: Raped in a bar, a woman (Jodie Foster) hires a prosecutor (Kelly McGillis) who goes after the patrons who encouraged her attackers.

programme.title: Gully
programme.desc: Three friends from a rough Los Angeles neighborhood embark on a wild night of out-of-control partying, but when the rampage stops, the retribution begins.

programme.title: Narc
programme.desc: A policeman (Jason Patric) and a tough veteran (Ray Liotta) try to solve the murder of the latter's undercover partner.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A defense attorney (Rosamund Pike) hires an enigmatic ex-Army investigator (Tom Cruise) to tackle the case of a highly trained sniper who apparently murdered five people at random.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: In the wake of another death, Boyd questions his decision to leave; Kenny steps up and embraces his new role; Jim rallies the town around his idea to build a radio tower; Fatima urges Ellis to make amends with his father before it is too late.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: A new security guard for a cash truck surprises his co-workers when he unleashes precision skills during a heist. Soon, the marksman's ultimate motive becomes clear as he takes dramatic and irrevocable steps to settle a score.

programme.title: The Marksman
programme.desc: Jim is a former Marine who lives a solitary life as a rancher along the Arizona-Mexican border. But his peaceful existence soon comes crashing down when he tries to protect a boy on the run from members of a vicious cartel.

programme.title: Black Sunday
programme.desc: A terrorist (Marthe Keller) lures a blimp pilot (Bruce Dern) into a plot to spray the Super Bowl with darts.

programme.title: The Prince
programme.desc: A retired assassin is drawn back into his former life and a confrontation with an old rival when his daughter is kidnapped.

programme.title: Navy SEALS
programme.desc: Sea/air/land commandos (Charlie Sheen, Michael Biehn) and a TV newswoman (Joanne Whalley-Kilmer) rescue hostages from terrorists armed with Stinger missiles.

programme.title: The Prophecy
programme.desc: Gabriel (Christopher Walken) and other angels jealous of humanity wage war using a police detective (Elias Koteas) and the soul of a Korean War veteran.

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: A New Yorker (Christopher Lambert) beheads a swordsman in a parking lot, continuing a battle of immortals.

programme.title: Waist Deep
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Tyrese Gibson) collides with members of a street gang after his car is stolen with his son inside.

programme.title: The Order
programme.desc: A priest (Heath Ledger) meets an immortal (Benno Fürmann) who can offer absolution to confessors by swallowing their sins.

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: In 1805 a British captain (Russell Crowe) and his crew endure hardships while trying to prevent a French ship from reaching the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Domino
programme.desc: Domino Harvey (Keira Knightley) turns her back on wealth and privilege for the excitement of life as a bounty hunter.

programme.title: Riddick
programme.desc: Left for dead on a sun-scorched planet, wanted criminal Riddick (Vin Diesel) must confront two teams of mercenaries, one of whom is led by a man from his past.

programme.title: Raw Deal
programme.desc: A former FBI agent (Arnold Schwarzenegger) infiltrates the biggest mob in Chicago and single-handedly wipes it out.

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: Mulder (David Duchovny) and Scully (Gillian Anderson) encounter a priest (Billy Connolly) with psychic visions when they reunite to solve a baffling missing-persons case.

programme.title: Rosewater
programme.desc: While covering an election protest in 2009 Iran, BBC journalist Maziar Bahari (Gael García Bernal) is arrested, imprisoned and tortured for nearly four months.

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: After her son is kidnapped and later found, a woman (Angelina Jolie) insists that the boy who was returned to her is not her child.

programme.title: Sliver
programme.desc: A book editor (Sharon Stone) has an affair with a voyeur (William Baldwin) in her building, a Manhattan murder scene wired for video.

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again
programme.desc: Johnny English springs back into action when a hacker reveals the identities of undercover agents in Britain. As a man with few skills and analogue methods, Johnny must overcome the challenges of modern technology to make this mission a success.

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three witchy New England women innocently conjure up the perfect man (Jack Nicholson), who is much more than he seems.

programme.title: Cinderella Man
programme.desc: Despite a string of losses and injuries, boxer Jim Braddock (Russell Crowe) makes a dramatic comeback and faces champion Max Baer.

programme.title: J. Edgar
programme.desc: Controversy surrounds the life of J. Edgar Hoover (Leonardo DiCaprio), the first director of the FBI.

programme.title: Deerskin
programme.desc: A middle-aged drifter becomes obsessed with a fringed deerskin jacket that seems to hold mystical powers.

programme.title: Rosewater
programme.desc: While covering an election protest in 2009 Iran, BBC journalist Maziar Bahari (Gael García Bernal) is arrested, imprisoned and tortured for nearly four months.

programme.title: The Butterfly Effect 2
programme.desc: A man (Eric Lively) travels back in time to alter the future after his sweetheart (Erica Durance) and friends die in a car accident.

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: After her son is kidnapped and later found, a woman (Angelina Jolie) insists that the boy who was returned to her is not her child.

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: King Leonidas (Sean Maguire) and his strapping warriors rise up to defend Sparta from invading Persians, bad punch-lines and celebrity look-alikes.

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Itinerant con men (Matt Damon, Heath Ledger) become caught in a real fairy tale after several maidens disappear in an enchanted forest.

programme.title: Half Brothers
programme.desc: A Mexican aviation executive is shocked to discover he has an American half brother he never knew about. They soon embark on a road trip, masterminded by their ailing father, tracing the path he took as an immigrant from Mexico to America.

programme.title: Master of the Shadowless Kick: Wong Kei-Ying
programme.desc: Quiet physician Wong from southern China masters a martial art to save his mentor, protect his son and stop a corrupt governor.

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: At a rundown desert motel, a woman (Ashley Judd) begins a tentative relationship with a newcomer (Michael Shannon), which quickly degenerates into paranoia after the man insists that he has tiny insects under his skin.

programme.title: Gun Shy
programme.desc: A therapist (Sandra Bullock) helps a legendary agent (Liam Neeson) who has lost his nerve but must fulfill one final obligation before retiring.

programme.title: Stoker
programme.desc: After the tragic death of a girl's father, an eccentric uncle comes to live with the teen (Mia Wasikowska) and her unstable mother (Nicole Kidman). Though she suspects the man has ulterior motives, she becomes increasingly infatuated with him.

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: A maverick cop (Mark Wahlberg) faces a supernatural battle when he descends into a dark underworld to find those who killed his family and his partner.

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: A young prodigy (Derek Luke) threatens the undefeated champion (Laurence Fishburne) of an underground club of motorcycle racers.

programme.title: The Untouchables
programme.desc: Eliot Ness (Kevin Costner) and his men fight Al Capone (Robert De Niro) in Chicago during Prohibition.

programme.title: Kajillionaire
programme.desc: Two con artists have spent 26 years training their only daughter to swindle, scam and steal at every turn. During a desperate and hastily conceived heist, they charm a stranger into joining them, only to have their entire world turned upside down.

programme.title: Dragged Across Concrete
programme.desc: Police partners descend into the criminal underworld after they are suspended for assaulting a suspect on video.

programme.title: The Crying Game
programme.desc: Irish Republican Army member Fergus (Stephen Rea) forms an unexpected bond with Jody (Forest Whitaker), a kidnapped British soldier in his custody, despite the warnings of fellow IRA members Jude (Miranda Richardson) and Maguire (Adrian Dunbar). Jody makes Fergus promise he'll visit his girlfriend, Dil (Jaye Davidson), in London, and when Fergus flees to the city, he seeks her out. Hounded by his former IRA colleagues, he finds himself increasingly drawn to the enigmatic, and surprising, Dil.

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels
programme.desc: Con artist Lawrence Jamieson (Michael Caine) is a longtime resident of a luxurious coastal resort, where he enjoys the fruits of his deceptions -- that is, until a competitor, Freddy Benson (Steve Martin), shows up. When the new guy's lowbrow tactics impinge on his own work, Jamieson resolves to get rid of him. Confident of his own duplicitous talents, Jamieson challenges Benson to a winner-takes-all competition: whoever swindles their latest mark first can stay, while the other must leave town.

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: Childhood friends Conner (Andy Samberg), Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) found fame and fortune after forming the hip-hop group the Style Boyz. Owen and Lawrence faded into the background when frontman Conner left the band to launch a successful solo career. Now, the egotistical singer decides to film a documentary about his life while he's still on top. When his second album flops, the camera is there to capture his world come crashing down.

programme.title: The Way, Way Back
programme.desc: Duncan (Liam James) is an awkward teen who must spend the summer at a beach house with his mother (Toni Collette), her boyfriend, Trent (Steve Carell), and Trent's obnoxious daughter. Trent can't resist badgering Duncan, so the youth steals away to a water park and gets a job that will help him stay off Trent's radar. As Duncan tends to the slides and pools of the aging park, he finds a father figure in wisecracking park manager Owen (Sam Rockwell) at a time when he desperately needs one.

programme.title: The Internship
programme.desc: After old-school salesmen Billy (Vince Vaughn) and Nick (Owen Wilson) find themselves downsized, Billy decides that, despite their complete lack of technological savvy, they should work for Google. The friends somehow manage to finagle internships at the Internet giant and promptly head out to Silicon Valley. Viewed with disdain by most of their fellow interns, Billy and Nick join forces with the rest of the misfit "nooglers" to make it through a series of competitive team challenges.

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: Slick Will, the mechanic for a legendary motorcycle racer named Smoke (Laurence Fishburne), is struck dead during an off-the-grid race. Following the funeral, and in opposition to his mother's protests, Slick Will's son, Kid (Derek Luke), starts racing in the same fringe circuit -- but, despite Kid's skill and showmanship, Smoke refuses to race him. Spurned by the man he looked up to, Kid starts a rival motorcycle gang called the "Biker Boyz," and a showdown between them is inevitable.

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: In 1928 Los Angeles, single mother Christine Collins (Angelina Jolie) arrives home to find her son, Walter, gone. Five months later her prayers are answered when Walter is found in Illinois. But to Christine's horror, the boy who steps off the train is not her son. Authorities vehemently dispute Christine's claim, and her one ally is a clergyman (John Malkovich) who sees the case as his chance to expose corruption in the Los Angeles Police Department and government.

programme.title: Strange but True
programme.desc: A woman tells her deceased boyfriend's family that she is pregnant.

programme.title: Laws of Attraction
programme.desc: Audrey Woods (Julianne Moore) and Daniel Rafferty (Pierce Brosnan) are rival divorce lawyers who are complete opposites: She relies on the law, while he relies on personality. They are hired to represent opposing sides of a celebrity divorce case involving a rock star (Michael Sheen), a dress designer (Parker Posey) and a custody dispute over an Irish castle. Audrey and Daniel wind up in Ireland together, where, to their astonishment, sparks fly between them.

programme.title: Dolapo Is Fine
programme.desc: A young Black woman faces pressure to change her name and hairstyle.

programme.title: Eight Men Out
programme.desc: The Chicago White Sox, who are set to play the Cincinnati Reds in the World Series of 1919, are at odds with their team's owner, Charles Comiskey (Clifton James), who pays his players unsatisfactory wages despite the team's popularity. A group of professional gamblers offers the Sox's best athletes a fortune to throw the series, and the players agree. However, their reputations and careers are ruined when the dark secret, dubbed the "Black Sox Scandal," reaches the public consciousness.

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: As a drummer with the '80s hair band Vesuvius, Robert "Fish" Fishman lived his dream as a rock 'n' roll demigod until his band mates kicked him out. Twenty years later, Fish gets a second shot at sitting on the throne of music stardom when his teenage nephew's group hires him as the new drummer.

programme.title: Kajillionaire
programme.desc: Two con artists have spent 26 years training their only daughter to swindle, scam and steal at every turn. During a desperate and hastily conceived heist, they charm a stranger into joining them, only to have their entire world turned upside down.

programme.title: Adventureland
programme.desc: It's the summer of 1987, and recent college grad James Brennan (Jesse Eisenberg) can't wait to begin his long-anticipated dream trip to Europe. Unfortunately, James' plans come to a screeching halt when his parents announce that they are unable to subsidize his trip. Forced to take a job at the local amusement park, James prepares for the worst summer ever, until he finds love with a captivating co-worker named Em (Kristen Stewart).

programme.title: Much Ado About Nothing
programme.desc: In this Shakespearean farce, Hero (Kate Beckinsale) and her groom-to-be, Claudio (Robert Sean Leonard), team up with Claudio's commanding officer, Don Pedro (Denzel Washington), the week before their wedding to hatch a matchmaking scheme. Their targets are sharp-witted duo Benedick (Kenneth Branagh) and Beatrice (Emma Thompson) -- a tough task indeed, considering their corresponding distaste for love and each other. Meanwhile, meddling Don John (Keanu Reeves) plots to ruin the wedding.

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: Aimless David Rice (Hayden Christensen) has the ability to instantly transport himself to any place he can imagine. He uses that gift to globe-trot, living on money he steals by "jumping" into bank vaults. He's captured by the evil Roland Cox (Samuel L. Jackson), who knows how to keep David from jumping. David escapes and reunites with his high school crush, Millie (Rachel Bilson), then forms an alliance with fellow jumper Griffin (Jamie Bell) and prepares for mortal combat with Cox.

programme.title: This Is 40
programme.desc: After many years of marriage, Pete (Paul Rudd) is the sole male in a household that includes his wife, Debbie (Leslie Mann), and two young daughters (Iris Apatow, Maude Apatow). As Pete struggles to keep his record label afloat, he and Debbie navigate a three-week course of sex and romance, career victories and financial hardships, aging parents and maturing children. They'll have to learn to forgive, forget and enjoy the rest of their lives -- before they kill each other.

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Tom (Ashton Kutcher) and Sarah (Brittany Murphy) are two lovebirds from different worlds. He's an average guy with a fondness for beer who works a low-level job, while she's an aspiring writer from a wealthy and cultured family. The disapproval of family and friends doesn't prevent the pair from marrying, but their disastrous honeymoon in Italy, with an unwelcome appearance by Sarah's ex-boyfriend, Peter (Christian Kane), nearly succeeds in tearing them apart.

programme.title: Assassins
programme.desc: Assassin Robert Rath (Sylvester Stallone) arrives at a funeral to kill a prominent mobster, only to witness rival hired gun Miguel Bain (Antonio Banderas) complete the job for him -- with grisly results. Horrified by the murder of innocent bystanders, Rath decides to take one last job and then return to civilian life. But finding his way out of the world of contract killing grows ever more dangerous as Rath falls for his target, Electra (Julianne Moore), and becomes a marked man himself.

programme.title: Joe
programme.desc: The rough-hewn boss (Nicolas Cage) of a lumber crew courts trouble when he steps in to protect the youngest member (Tye Sheridan) of his team from an abusive father.

programme.title: Drillbit Taylor
programme.desc: For three misfit freshmen, the first day of high school becomes a living hell when Filkins (Alex Frost), the school bully, zeroes in on them. Chubby Ryan (Troy Gentile), diminutive Emmit (David Dorfman) and skinny Wade (Nate Hartley) all feel the wrath of Filkins. Realizing that their own chance for survival is to hire a bodyguard, the pals place an ad in the newspaper. Answering the call is Drillbit Taylor (Owen Wilson) ; armed, dangerous and completely fake.

programme.title: Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man
programme.desc: In this action movie, tough biker Harley Davidson (Mickey Rourke) teams up with his cowboy-hat-wearing buddy known as the Marlboro Man (Don Johnson) to help save the bar of a mutual friend. Enacting a plan to rob an armored bank vehicle, the two are surprised to find that they've heisted a massive shipment of a new drug. Soon the corrupt bank head, Chance Wilder (Tom Sizemore), sends trained killers to take out Harley and Marlboro, with the duo fighting for their lives.

programme.title: Charlie St. Cloud
programme.desc: Adored by his single mother and his little brother Sam, Charlie St. Cloud (Zac Efron) is an accomplished sailor and college-bound senior with a bright future ahead of him. When Sam dies in a terrible accident, Charlie's dreams die with him. But, so strong is the brothers' bond that, in the hour before each sunset, Charlie and Sam meet to play catch. The return of a former classmate (Amanda Crew) leads Charlie to a difficult choice: remain stuck in the past, or let love lead him to the future.

programme.title: Navy SEALS
programme.desc: Navy special operations forces go to the Middle East to free a helicopter crew taken captive by terrorist Ben Shaheed (Nicholas Kadi). After learning that Shaheed has killed a hostage and acquired missiles on the black market, Lt. James Curran (Michael Biehn) and Lt. Dale Hawkins (Charlie Sheen) consult with a reporter who is an expert on Shaheed and his motives. As Shaheed embarks on his plan to violently derail regional treaty talks, the special operations forces make their move.

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: When the mystical Russell Nash (Christopher Lambert) kills a man in a sword fight in a New York City parking lot, he leaves a sliver of an ancient weapon lodged in a car in the process. After brilliant forensics specialist Brenda Wyatt (Roxanne Hart) recovers evidence of the mysterious weapon, she and her partner, Lt. Frank Moran (Alan North), embark on an investigation Of Nash that will land them in the middle of a dangerous, centuries-old feud between powerful immortals.

programme.title: Twisted
programme.desc: Recently promoted and transferred to the homicide division, Inspector Jessica Shepard (Ashley Judd) feels pressure to prove herself -- and what better way than by solving San Francisco's latest murder? However, as Shepard and her partner, Mike Delmarco (Andy Garcia), soon discover, the victim shared a romantic connection to her. As more of Shepard's ex-lovers turn up dead, her mind starts to become unstable, and she begins to wonder if she could be the very killer she's trying to track down.

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: In this remake of the classic French farce "La Cage aux Folles," engaged couple Val Goldman (Dan Futterman) and Barbara Keeley (Calista Flockhart) shakily introduce their future in-laws. Val's father, Armand (Robin Williams), a gay Miami drag club owner, pretends to be straight and attempts to hide his relationship with Albert (Nathan Lane), his life partner and the club's flamboyant star attraction, so as to please Barbara's father, controversial Republican Sen. Kevin Keeley (Gene Hackman).

programme.title: Old Dogs
programme.desc: While preparing for an important business deal, two bachelors (John Travolta, Robin Williams) become the unexpected caretakers of twin children. One debacle after another follows, as the two clueless men try to take care of both their business duties and the rambunctious siblings. Though their lives are turned upside-down, the men may just gain an understanding of what is really important in life.

programme.title: Fine China
programme.desc: A woman erupts into a song and dance after dinner at her house turns tragic.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: For Dan Gallagher (Michael Douglas), life is good. He is on the rise at his New York law firm, is happily married to his wife, Beth (Anne Archer), and has a loving daughter. But, after a casual fling with a sultry book editor named Alex (Glenn Close), everything changes. Jilted by Dan, Alex becomes unstable, her behavior escalating from aggressive pursuit to obsessive stalking. Dan realizes that his main problem is not hiding his affair, but rather saving himself and his family.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: Lovable Englishman Charles (Hugh Grant) and his group of friends seem to be unlucky in love. When Charles meets a beautiful American named Carrie (Andie MacDowell) at a wedding, he thinks his luck may have changed. But, after one magical night, Carrie returns to the States, ending what might have been. As Charles and Carrie's paths continue to cross -- over a handful of nuptials and one funeral -- he comes to believe they are meant to be together, even if their timing always seems to be off.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Dave Buznik (Adam Sandler) is usually a mild-mannered nonconfrontational guy. But after an altercation aboard an airplane, he is remanded to the care of an anger-management therapist, Dr. Buddy Rydell (Jack Nicholson), who could probably use a little anger management himself.

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: FBI criminal profiler Will Graham (William L. Petersen) is called out of early retirement to assist on a serial murder case involving a killer known as the "Tooth Fairy" (Tom Noonan). Graham enlists the help of imprisoned serial killer -- and cannibal -- Dr. Hannibal Lecktor (Brian Cox), who is the reason Graham took an early retirement. Soon, Graham and the FBI are entangled in a deadly cat-and-mouse game between the Tooth Fairy, Lecktor and an interfering journalist (Stephen Lang).

actor.role: FBI Agent Will Graham (as William Petersen)

programme.title: Reservation Road
programme.desc: The fates of two men and their families converge following a tragic accident. Ethan Lerner (Joaquin Phoenix) and his family are on the way home from their son's cello recital. The same evening, law associate Dwight Arno (Mark Ruffalo) and his son are returning from a ballgame. In a flash, the unthinkable happens, and Ethan's son dies beneath the wheels of Dwight's car. Dwight speeds away, and Ethan, as the only witness to the tragedy, begins his quest for justice.

programme.title: Doubt
programme.desc: In 1964 the winds of change are sweeping through Sister Aloysius' (Meryl Streep) St. Nicholas school. Father Flynn (Philip Seymour Hoffman), a charismatic priest, is advocating reform of the school's strict customs, and the first black student has just been accepted. When a fellow nun (Amy Adams) tells Sister Aloysius that Father Flynn may be paying too much personal attention to the student, Sister Aloysius begins a personal crusade against the priest -- despite her lack of evidence.

programme.title: Island of Bryan
programme.desc: Bryan tackles off-season projects at the hotel with a special helper, while Sarah begins to define her new chapter in Florida.

programme.title: Scott's Vacation House Rules
programme.sub-title: Scandi Ski Chalet; Vicky and Todd
programme.desc: Vicky and Todd recently bought a dated old house near a ski hill, and they think it could earn them some money - if the proper reno job were done.

programme.title: House Hunters International
programme.desc: A woman with Welsh roots moves her family to Wales to begin graduate school in music; she also discovers she's pregnant, and they look for a place with four bedrooms and near her school.

programme.title: House Hunters International
programme.sub-title: A Fling With the Melbourne Thing
programme.desc: Two best friends look for a break after college and decide to move to Melbourne, Australia. They're looking for something with an open concept that has two bedrooms, and one is inclined to spend more for an updated kitchen and wardrobe space.

programme.title: House Hunters
programme.desc: Two twentysomethings buy their first house in Ithaca, N.Y.; she wants a move-in-ready home, but he wants to put his construction skills to the test on a fixer-upper.

programme.title: House Hunters International
programme.desc: A Brit wants to settle in Gandia, Spain, with her husband and kids; he wants to downsize in the city center, she envisions a Spanish villa with an English garden.

programme.title: The Detectives
programme.desc: "The Detectives" brings gripping and factual work of detectives to life. Every hourlong episode features a different detective as he relives his most challenging investigation and reflects on the impact it had in relation to Canadian law enforcement and the Canadian way of life. Intimate and raw interviews are laid bare for all to see in this meticulously crafted documentary. Such investigations include a man going missing after meeting someone from an online dating site, a 3-year-old witness to a murder in his home, a bomb threat and a killer threatening to strike again, and the disappearance of a young woman, among others.
